DOC.detailed_description: Necrotizing enterocolitis ( NEC ) condition , generally affect premature infant , intestine become ischemic ( lack oxygen and/or blood flow ) . NEC occur 5-15 % extremely low birth weight ( ELBW ) infant . Isolated focal intestinal perforation ( IP ) less common condition , affect estimate 4 % ELBWs , hole develop intestine leak fluid abdominal cavity . Outcome infant NEC and/or IP poor : 49 % die half survive infant neurodevelopmentally impaired . Surgical option NEC IP include two possible procedure : peritoneal drainage , tube place abdominal cavity small incision fluid drain ; laparotomy , incision make abdomen necrotic intestine remove . Drainage may follow laparotomy .
